item.title: Bitcoin was sent to my address, but I did not realize bitcoin core was synchronizing. Will I get that bitcoin back?
item.description:
Bitcoin was sent to my address, but I did not realize bitcoin core was synchronizing. Will I get that bitcoin back?

This train only runs in one direction: House members often run for the Senate when a seat in their state opens up. I can't think of a former Senator who ever ran for the House. Being a Senator is a much better job in many ways.

item.title: How to Make a Socket Selling Power and Internet Access for Ether
item.description:
How to Make a Socket Selling Power and Internet Access for Ether

Earlier ForkLog wrote about Valery Litvin , a Belarusian blockchain developer from the Cyber.Fund team, and the smart socket selling power and Wi-Fi access for Ether he had created. The device has been presented and successfully tested at the recent Blockchain Conference Kyiv.

item.title: Could Ethereum be sold to another company and the current dev team replaced?
item.description:
Could Ethereum be sold to another company and the current dev team replaced?

Answer: Not really ethereum is not a company but an foundation that produce an open source platform called ethereum. The blockchain is developed by them but the community (user,developers, nodes) own it. In the unlikley event ethereum got sold the blockchain will be forked (copied) and most peo...

item.title: Kraken Announces Major Update in MtGox Claims Investigation
item.description:
Kraken Announces Major Update in MtGox Claims Investigation

Global digital asset exchange Kraken shared major news from Tokyo's court-appointed trustee in the investigation of claims from MtGox creditors. During a scheduled and long-awaited Creditor's Meeting in Tokyo, Trustee Nobuaki Kobayashi announced on Wednesday that 24,750 creditors have filed claims to date.

item.title: Judge Throws Out PlayPen Evidence As FBI Refuses To Disclose Details
item.description:
Judge Throws Out PlayPen Evidence As FBI Refuses To Disclose Details

The story regarding the FBI hacking Tor to infect the PlayPen platform is not over just yet. A judge excluded the evidence presented by the law enforcement agency after they refused to detail how they hacked the website in the first place.

item.title: What security weaknesses result from using off chain solutions?
item.description:
What security weaknesses result from using off chain solutions?

With the Lightning network specifically, the security of the transactions always depends on being able to take the transaction onto the real blockchain "if needed". When both parties cooperate, the the number of on chain transactions is minimized, but both parties rely on being able to cash out, using the real blockchain, if the other party stops cooperating or goes offline for an extended period of time.

item.title: Tech Reporter Gets NFC Payment Chip Implant In His Hand
item.description:
Tech Reporter Gets NFC Payment Chip Implant In His Hand

When a Bitcoin user embedded a payment chip into his hand, people assumed he was crazy. But apparently, he sparked a bright concept, as tech reporter Charlie Warzel did the same with an NFC-enabled payment chip. Also read: Kraken Details the Latest Mt Gox Creditors Meeting It is important for users to keep in mind that this type of body modification carries certain risks.

item.title: Third Key Solution's Decentralized Arbitration and Mediation Network to bridge law and smart contracts
item.description:
Third Key Solution's Decentralized Arbitration and Mediation Network to bridge law and smart contracts

Smart Contracts are among the hottest of all topics in the FinTech world today, but how exactly does a nation's justice system recognize, interface with, and acknowledge the outcomes from smart contracts?

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Switching up the time frames - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Switching up the time frames - NEWSBTC

Here's what we are looking at in the bitcoin price this morning out of Europe We are going to start off this morning's analysis with a daily chart. It's little more expansive a time frame than we normally focus on, but it offers us some insight, so it's worth looking at quickly.

item.title: Kraken stops supporting Namecoin due to low trading volume
item.description:
Kraken stops supporting Namecoin due to low trading volume

During the last couple of days, Kraken has received lots of media attention, mainly thanks to their involvement in paying back people affected by the Mt Gox hack. However, not many know that the bitcoin exchange recently decided to reassess which of their coins were worth keeping and not.
